byline.original: By HENRY N. DORRIS Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Cols Stimson and Knox state views at Sen com hearings
snippet: WASHINGTON, July 2--The Senate Military Affairs Committee today voted to recommend confirmation of Henry L. Stimson as Secretary of War. The vote of 14 to 3 came after two hours of questioning in which he defended his views on national defense and...

headline.main: VOTE FOR STIMSON; Senate Military Group Advises Confirmation After Hearing Him HE STICKS TO HIS GUNS Nominee Reproaches Senator Taft for Tenor of Questions --Backs Military Training Dispute Over Wording President Phoned to Him SENATORS VOTE TO BACK STIMSON 'Un-neutrality' Held Necessary Senator Taft Reproached

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 2--The Senate Military Affairs Committee today voted to recommend confirmation of Henry L. Stimson as Secretary of War. The vote of 14 to 3 came after two hours of questioning in which he defended his views on national defense and aid to the Allies and asserted that his appointment to the Cabinet had "no relation to politics whatever."
